= Keycloak

We use https://www.keycloak.org/[Keycloak] as our OpenID Connect provider.

== Running keycloak

We will use https://docs.docker.com/compose/[Docker compose] to run Keycloak,
along with a https://www.postgresql.org/[PostgreSQL] database
and https://httpbin.org/[httpbin] for debugging.

1. Start Keycloak through `docker-compose up`.
2. Open http://localhost:8090 and login with username `admin` and password `Pa55w0rd`.
3. Add a new realm named `spring-cloud-gateway-realm`.
4. Import `realm-export.json`, with `If a resource exists: Skip`.
5. Add a new user with username `alice`.
6. Under Credentials set user password to `password` with `Temporary: OFF`.
7. Under Role Mappings add `offline_access` to Assigned Roles.

== What you'll get

* a realm named `spring-cloud-gateway-realm`.
* a client named `spring-cloud-gateway-client` with:
 - `Access Type: confidential` and `Credentials Secret:k725YLf1lT3nC88Ki8L3plZa8Z3Jeo37` 
 - `Valid Redirect URIs: http://localhost:8080/*`
 - `Access Token Lifespan: 20 minutes`
* a user named `alice`.

== Getting a JSON Web Token

We want to extract a valid JSON Web Token to use in our leave application tests.
For that we will throw up two quick components;
 - first a OAuth2 Client application, named Leave App Gateway;
 - secondly httpbin, which echoes back the request details.

0. Ensure `leaveapp-initial` is not running.
1. Navigate to `spring-security-workshop/adding-spring-security/leaveapp-gateway/`
2. Start the leaveapp-gateway application `./mvnw spring-boot:run`
3. Open http://localhost:8080/get in your browser.
4. The browser will redirect you to Keycloak to login.
5. Use `alice` / `password` to login.
6. Keycloak will redirect you back to the gateway.
7. The gateway will call out to httpbin.
8. Httpbin will show you the GET request details.
9. Your access token is the value behind `Bearer` under `headers > Authorization`.

== Cleaning up

Once you're done running Keycloak, you can shut it down and clean it up through:

.Clean up Keycloak
[source,bash]
----
docker-compose down --volumes
----
